record.title: ORDERS FOR MONDAY, OCTOBER 29, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR MONDAY, OCTOBER 29, 2007 -- (Senate - October 26, 2007)

[Page: S13495]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 3 p.m., Monday; that on Monday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period of morning business for 90 minutes, with Senators permitted to speak for up to 10 minutes each; with Senator Boxer in control of the first 60 minutes, and the remaining 30 minutes under the control of the Republicans; that following morning business, the Senate resume consideration of Calendar No. 158, S. 294, Amtrak authorization.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
